intro: Grewia praecox subsp. praecox, commonly known as the early yellow globemallow, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, yellowish-white flowers that appear in clusters, typically in early spring. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the genus Grewia, which is part of the Malvaceae family.
